channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The standard of cleaning round the Clock house and Beckenham road area, 21st July
item.description:
The standard of cleaning round the Clock house and Beckenham road areas is very poor, you say its been fixed on thing, but that not true, the clock house stairs care and allay is still not been done. and right along Beckenham road needs to been done more times a week, as it a heath issues
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Open trench approximately 2 inches deep across entire pavement, 21st July
item.description:

item.title: The Whole Flat Is A State, 21st July
item.description:
Bins are overflowing and they STINK Large BACK grass area filled with cigarette butts and discarded food Large FRONT grass areas filled with rubbish and plastic/paper rubbish Stairwell and lifts have spit and chewing gum on them sometimes
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cazenove Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Grass still reds cutting, 21st July
item.description:
Réf 7778884. The grass and the bushes are still the same. Getting worse. In fact. Someone should actually goes further down the entrance to see the bushes. I don’t think that this has been investigated properly. That bit is always forgotten and not cut properly. Resident of Southborough lane and their children do use the entrance opposite oxhawth crecent.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Lane, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wasps NEst, 21st July
item.description:
Wasps nest in trees by car park. Please can this be looked into and action taken as stinging residents in area. Area is not well maintained and foxes live in area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Percy Terrace, Petts Wood, London

item.title: Fly tipping and food waste, 21st July
item.description:
There is once again household items which have been dumped. Including a freezer full of food which is now attracting pests. When will Hackney council take this seriously?!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Foulden Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown nettles, branches etc, 21st July
item.description:
For the last few weeks the footpath weeds etc are growing over the path and it will be impossible to walk through within the next week or so. There are nettles which are dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shuttlemead, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Walkway between estates used as dump, 21st July
item.description:
Do you know who is responsible for this bit of land between Ruston Road and Spindle Close? If its not the council, can we find out who and force them to take responsibility please? In this walkway between the estates, there is a shopping trolley full of rubbish, bicycle tires, litter of all sorts, including big bags of rubbish. This has been like this for months. There is wood flytipped at one end against the bushes on Ruston Road and a mattress dumped next to a shipping container at the end of Spindle Close Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Spindle Close, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No speed limit, 21st July
item.description:

item.title: Water leak, 21st July
item.description:
This water leak which starts Outside the tanning shop on the High Street has been ongoing for a long time. The water is leaking down the high street down the pavement. Wasting gallons and gallons of water. It is also a danger for people slipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, High Street, Widmore, London

item.title: Camping near tennis courts, 21st July
item.description:
Camping east of tennis courts and north of bowling club in tree area on old pitch and putt - not first time camping has occurred here and concerned about ‘ mess’ and the fact that the area is also used as a toilet !!! Same occurs by fishermen who camp overnight with excrement seen in woods south of the lake!!!! Ward Security do not seem to be doing what they are paid for ?????

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Mead, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaf clearing on South Sea Street, 21st July
item.description:
A Council cleaning vehicle swept away the leaves on the majority of South Sea Street on Saturday 19 July but left the part the road that leads to Rope Street. This part of South Sea Street is a designated cycle route so should be kept clear of leaves (as well as the adjoining pavement next to the Rainbow Quay development). I have not seen any Council cleaners on South Sea Street for many months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Sea Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
